ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard seeks advice...
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree, why bother, it ll just rot and get out of date and wind up giving missinformation to young bards.  Tell em they can post a link to your site. It s the
ygData.messageBody:
I agree, why bother, it'll just rot and get out of date and wind up giving
missinformation to young bards. Tell em they can post a link to your site.
It's the best site I've seen for song analysis.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath

>
> The only problem I have with it is that Stratics hasn't kept up at all
> on EQ, with a lot of their content and reference pages still unchanged
> since beta. As long as their hosting wasn't exclusive I guess there'd be
> no downside but it wouldn't be very good to see the song list locked
> away on a site that hardly anyone goes to due to it's mostly out of date
> info.
>
> Check their bard song list, hidden away under strategy and
> statistics(tm)->class articles->bard spell list. They have 20 songs.
> I guess it's nice that they are looking for a better list now but my
> question would be; why, after over a year of total neglect, are they
> bothering?
>
>
> On Tue, May 23/00, "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...> wrote:
> > I received an email last night from Manga of the EverQuest Stratics
site.
> > They are interested in hosting the Song Analysis on their network. I
> > consider the Song Analysis to be not just mine, but all of yours as
well. As
> > it would not be what it is without the combined wisdom of all the
wonderful
> > bards on this mailing list and on the Concert Hall message board. Your
> > opinions on this matter mean a lot to me, so please let me know what
your
> > feelings are.
